dt: {bc}to commit (money) in order to earn a financial return
{bc}to make use of for future benefits or advantages

dt.t: were deeply {wi}invested{/wi} in their children's lives

et: Italian {it}investire{/it} to clothe, invest money, from Latin, to clothe
shortdef: to commit (money) in order to earn a financial return
to make use of for future benefits or advantages
to involve or engage especially emotionally

et: Medieval Latin {it}investire{/it}, from Latin, to clothe

dt: {bc}to array in the symbols of office or honor
{bc}to grant someone control or authority over {bc}{sx|vest||}

et: Middle French {it}investir{/it}, from Old Italian {it}investire{/it}, from Latin, to surround
dt: {bc}to surround with troops or ships so as to prevent escape or entry

et: Latin {it}investire{/it} to clothe, surround, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}vestis{/it} garment {ma}{mat|wear|}{/ma}
shortdef: to array in the symbols of office or honor
to furnish with power or authority
to grant someone control or authority over : vest

dt: {bc}to give (someone) the power and authority of (a particular position or title)

shortdef: to give (someone) the power and authority of (a particular position or title)

dt: {bc}to use money for (something) in order to earn more money

dt.t: He made a fortune by {it}investing in{/it} real estate.

dt: {bc}to spend money for building or improving (something)

dt.t: The city will {it}invest{/it} millions of dollars {it}in{/it} two new schools.
The city plans to {it}invest{/it} heavily {it}in{/it} its educational system this year.

dt: {bc}to give (time or effort) in order to do something or make something better

dt.t: A lot of time was {it}invested in{/it} the project.
We need to {it}invest{/it} more effort {it}in{/it} educating our children.

dt: {bc}to spend money on (something useful or helpful to oneself)

dt.t: I am planning to {it}invest in{/it} a good coat.

shortdef: to use money for (something) in order to earn more money
to spend money for building or improving (something)
to give (time or effort) in order to do something or make something better

dt: {bc}to join another or others in {d_link|investing|invest:1} in something

dt.t: They also {wi}coinvested{/wi} in Firefly, an Internet upstart from MIT's media lab …
A dozen or so quasi-public financing institutions {wi}co-invest{/wi} with private banks and venture capitalists in companies …

utxt.t: … Westcott and his {wi}coinvestors{/wi} owned 40% of the league …

shortdef: to join another or others in investing in something
